text.p: The finance director of Imetal said on Wednesday 1996 sales may increase from 1995 and slightly exceed eight billion francs.
"Sales may be slightly over eight billion francs this year,"Jacques Drijard said. Sales reached 7.74 billion francs in 1995.
Drijard was speaking to a seminar organised by the Ferri brokerage.
He also said Imetal would strive in the coming years to maintain "at least" the growth in earnings per share it had achieved in the past.
This would be reached mainly through external growth operations, he said.
"Through a strategy of acquisitions made at reasonable prices in businesses related to our activities we are hoping to eventually turn our one digit growth into a two digit growth," he added.
Imetal said in September that it expected net pre-exceptional profit to rise in 1996 from the 551 million francs in 1995.
Net pre-exceptional earnings per share rose to 37.21 francs in 1995 from 34.22 francs in 1994.
